entry.title: Game: Hebereke (NES, 1991) (2)
entry.content:
Game: Hebereke (NES, 1991) (2)20130324
I beat this game today. I found the second to last mini-boss to
be really easy once you had an idea of what the strategy was. The
last boss was REALLY hard, because every time I threw the ball
back it missed and then I got hit again. It was very
challenging. The game reminded me a lot of Metroid at the end,
because every time I died, I stood in front of a frog creature
and grinded to get my energy back. It was very tedious and un-fun
to do, of course.

Overall, I found the game to be very enjoyable. I think it is a
bit too maze-like to enjoy again. But I like the feel of the
world a lot and enjoyed the experience.

Total time: 3:08
  • Video Games
  • Hebereke
  • NES
  • 1991

entry.title: Movie: Battle: Los Angeles, starring Aaron Eckhart (2011)
entry.content:
Movie: Battle: Los Angeles, starring Aaron Eckhart (2011)20130324
I really liked this movie. I think my favourite part of it is that
(a) the war is defensive, (b) the idea that the military simpler
exists to protect civilians is very prominent, (c) the soldiers
are "everymen" who aren't the focal point of the war... except a
little bit at the end, and (d) the nobility of the troops. 

It's a very exciting movie too and the alien threat seems "real"
and not super comic-y. It was really great. I really liked the
depiction of aliens and the way the achieved superiority---the
cyborg enhancements and the way they were driving around
artillery/cannon like units.
  • Movies
  • 2011

entry.title: Game: Adventures of Lolo 3 (NES, 1991) (5)
entry.content:
Game: Adventures of Lolo 3 (NES, 1991) (5)20130323
I played this morning for about two hours and got to 13-5. I got
really tired of the game... I'd play a level for about 15 minutes
and then get stuck and have to look up a hint. It feels like I'm
not really solving the levels anymore. I assuage my feelings of
inadequacy by thinking that it's because so much seems to rely on
the timing, places where enemies will respawn after being blocked,
etc.

Despite quitting, I've enjoyed this game a lot and recommend it.

WK9D HPGG NNDiamondG BP4W

Total time: 10:09
  • Video Games
  • Adventures of Lolo 3
  • NES
  • 1991

entry.title: Game: Final Fantasy 3 (NES, 1990)
entry.content:
Game: Final Fantasy 3 (NES, 1990)20130323
I played for about thirty minutes. But I used some Game Genie
codes to lessen the grinding and one of them crashed the game
when I first tried to buy something. My brief experience with the
game made me feel like it was fine but quite a bit slow and hard
to love. The graphics aren't beautiful. I think I will try
playing again another time or maybe with the DS remake, where
hopefully the speed is faster.

Total time: 0:29

  • NES

entry.title: Game: Hebereke (NES, 1991)
entry.content:
Game: Hebereke (NES, 1991)20130323
I played this game for an hour and a half. It's really cute
looking and the colors are bright. The gameplay is pretty
tight---although the need to press Down to squash enemies is a bit
annoying and sometimes it is painful to make tight jumps because
of the huge sprites. The world feels really big and connected in a
cool way (like Metroid, but unlike, say, Castlevania 2 where the
world is huge but uselessly connected.) I'm enjoying the game.

*BGR*R
GRG*GG
**R**B
**G*RG
GBRBR*
BG*B*B

Total time: 1:30
  • Video Games
  • Hebereke
  • NES
  • 1991

entry.title: Game: Adventures of Lolo 3 (NES, 1991) (2)
entry.content:
Game: Adventures of Lolo 3 (NES, 1991) (2)20130320
In the afternoon, I played for about an hour and a half, I got up
to 6-2. Later in the day, I played for another hour-ish and got
to 8-1. My current password is:

DiRTrV-WGD4-Pl9B9-26JY

I'm finding this game has a higher percentage of the kinds of Lolo
puzzles I don't like. I don't like when a puzzle requires a lot of
execution skill, because the controls in these games are so
awkward. I also don't like it when you have to use "holes" and
riding on eggs in water, because you can't really predict where
they will go, so it seems unfair because you can't plan your
solution totally before doing it. Nevertheless, I'm still having
fun.

Total time: 3:47
  • Video Games
  • Adventures of Lolo 3
  • NES
  • 1991

entry.title: Movie: The Adventures of Tintin, starring Jamie Bell (2011)
entry.content:
Movie: The Adventures of Tintin, starring Jamie Bell (2011)20130320
My wife and I watched this without really knowing anything about
the story or what to expect. I had assumed it would be a "kids
movie", but it really wasn't designed for very young kids. I
thought that the plot was interesting and fairly advanced for the
overall feel of the movie. It seems superfluously
computer-animated. There's nothing about the world or the story
that really needs it, and instead because it is animated there are
some ridiculous set pieces that don't feel right for the world. I
found the style to be a bit strange... the heads on all the
characters except for Tintin are too big. It was definitely
striking visually.
  • Movies
  • 2011

entry.title: Game: Adventures of Lolo 3 (NES, 1991)
entry.content:
Game: Adventures of Lolo 3 (NES, 1991)20130319
I started this and played up to Level 3 Room 9. The main
difference between this and the previous games is (a) the ability
to play as Lala, which seems to just be a sprite change, and (b)
the separate areas that divide up the puzzles into a kind of
narrative. I find it a bit stupid and tedious to have to do
things other than solve puzzles. It seems strange to me that the
creators would think that people really care about the "world" of
Lolo enough to want to feel like they are "exploring" it, rather
than just doing puzzles. In any case, the puzzles I've done so
far have been fun and have included a few tough ones. I'm looking
forward to completing it.

Total time: 0:55
  • Video Games
  • Adventures of Lolo 3
  • NES
  • 1991

entry.title: Game: Battletoads (NES, 1991)
entry.content:
Game: Battletoads (NES, 1991)20130319
I played through this game up to the second phase of the speeder
race. I had a feeling about it very similar to Double Dragon: the
mechanics are so boring and trivial, it's amazing that it can be
entertaining at all. It is fairly cute that each of the early
levels is so different, but it just accentuates the capriciousness
of the game. I didn't keep going after running out of Continues
during the race.

Total time: 0:14
  • Video Games
  • Battletoads
  • NES
  • 1991

entry.title: Game: Downtown Special: Kunio-kun no Jidaigeki da yo - Zenin Shūgō! (NES, 1991)
entry.content:
Game: Downtown Special: Kunio-kun no Jidaigeki da yo - Zenin Shūgō! (NES, 1991)20130319
As a concept, this game sounds amazing: River City Ransom with a
Japanese country-side theme and old-timey era. However, I found it
to be much less satisfying than River City Ransom. The game world
seems huge in comparison and confusingly organized: the majority
of the time I played I just wandered around in a big circle and
ended back in the starting town. I had no idea where I was
supposed to go or how to trigger the boss encounters that control
the progression of these games. The lack of context and the
increased world size really did damage to my appreciation of
it. The game did seem more complex in other ways too though: you
seem to be able to pick up, spin, and throw enemies, which was
new. Also, your "brother" is always present, if A.I. controlled,
which is neat. Nevertheless, I couldn't play it and put it down.

Total time: 0:07
  • Video Games
  • Downtown Special: Kunio-kun no Jidaigeki da yo - Zenin Shūgō!
  • NES
  • 1991

entry.title: Game: Metal Storm (NES, 1991)
entry.content:
Game: Metal Storm (NES, 1991)20130319
I played this game for three and a half hours and beat it. I used
an infinite lives code, so I didn't have to replay anything after
I beat it. I found the most challenging part of the game to be
Boss 5, especially because I had the Shield and Pea-shooter
rather than the Powerbeam. (Later, during the boss rush, when I
fought Boss 5, it was still hard but MUCH easier.) The game is
really interesting and does some really mind-warping things with
the gravity flipping and the toroidal level designs. I had a lot
of fun playing it. My final score was 528,154.

Total time: 3:29
  • Video Games
  • Metal Storm
  • NES
  • 1991

entry.title: Game: Ninja Gaiden 3 (NES, 1991)
entry.content:
Game: Ninja Gaiden 3 (NES, 1991)20130319
Although I've beaten the other Ninja Gaiden games, I found this
one to be too much pain to be worth it. I got to 2-2D after 20
minutes and got sent all the way back to the beginning of 2-2A,
despite there being a lot of distance between those points and
many screen transitions. It just felt like I had done these games
too many times and I don't have the patience to deal with the
randomness and jumpiness again. It felt like the enemies did more
damage on average this time, but that there was less kick-back,
which is nice. I didn't keep going.

Total time: 0:20
  • Video Games
  • Ninja Gaiden 3
  • NES
  • 1991

entry.title: Game: Double Dragon 3 (NES, 1991)
entry.content:
Game: Double Dragon 3 (NES, 1991)20130318
I got passed the first room and died outside immediately and had
no continues or extra lives. It was very unsatisfying. The
mechanics are really terrible and hard to control. The enemies
are sponges that seem to be able to take an infinite number of
hits. I don't understand why this game could've been seen as a
so much fun and so important.

Total time: 0:03
  • Video Games
  • Double Dragon 3
  • NES
  • 1991

entry.title: Game: G.I. Joe: A Real American Hero (NES, 1991)
entry.content:
Game: G.I. Joe: A Real American Hero (NES, 1991)20130318
I picked three random dudes and played to the boss of the first
level three times, once with each of them. The final form of the
boss seems un-dodgeable and I died, despite starting on full
health and not being hit by the first form after my first try. I
felt like an annoying NES game without anything redeeming
now. For the time, it felt solid control and graphics-wise, but
it feels unplayable today.

Total time: 0:08
  • Video Games
  • G.I. Joe: A Real American Hero
  • NES
  • 1991

entry.title: Game: New Ghostbusters II (NES, 1990)
entry.content:
Game: New Ghostbusters II (NES, 1990)20130318
This was an adorable game. I beat the first level and played the
second until I died. I found it to be super cute and to really
capture the feeling of "Ghostbusters" with the mechanics of one
character using the stun beam and the other getting the trap in
place. Unfortunately, it was very one-note and it felt like doing
better and getting further was just a matter of memorizing
placement until you could get through unharmed. I feel like it
taught me everything it was going to after a very short amount of
time. It was definitely inspired though.

Total time: 0:08
  • Video Games
  • New Ghostbusters II
  • NES
  • 1990

entry.title: Game: Ni no Kuni: Wrath of the White Witch (PS3, 2013) (9)
entry.content:
Game: Ni no Kuni: Wrath of the White Witch (PS3, 2013) (9)20130318
I played today for two and a half hours and beat the game. I
basically just had to go through the final dungeon and beat the
final boss marathon. I didn't find the bosses that challenging.
The formula was to use the last two spells over and over and then
use items to get back some MP. It was a bit of a disappointing
ending. In addition, there's not really a final cut-scene... they
spent most of their "ending" juice on the faux-ending is seems.

Overall, I'd say that this game was beautiful and mechanically
sound, but too boring for my taste. There was a lot of variability
in the game... like the treat system and the huge number of
familiars... that I never really needed to use, which felt like a
let down. I wish there would have been more reason to switch
familiars, for example, rather than just find a few that I had
affinities for and use them the whole time. I also wish that
faster modes of ground transportation would have unlocked, because
moving around in the game started to feel really tedious.

I can imagine recommending the game to a kid, but I don't think I
would to an adult and definitely not a marginal RPG fan. If you
are just going to play one or two RPGs, there are much better
options.

Total time: 39:03
  • Video Games
  • Ni no Kuni: Wrath of the White Witch
  • PS3
  • 2013

entry.title: Game: Tecmo Super Bowl (NES, 1991)
entry.content:
Game: Tecmo Super Bowl (NES, 1991)20130318
I found this game totally indecipherable. I don't understand
football very well and I had no clue what I was supposed to be
doing at each point in the game. My hope was that an old football
game would be abstract, like the Technos soccer and hockey games
are, but I was disappointed.

Total time: 0:03
